meanings.definition: Somewhat rough in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The cat's tongue felt roughish as it licked my hand.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden table had a roughish surface.
meanings.sent3: The roughish sandpaper made the job more challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her roughish voice grated on my ears like sandpaper.
meanings.sent5: The roughish bark of the tree scratched my skin.

meanings.definition: Having a slightly rough or unrefined quality.
meanings.sent1: The roughish edges of the paper cut my finger.
meanings.sent2: His roughish manners made him stand out in the refined crowd.
meanings.sent3: She tried to smooth out the roughish fabric of the dress.
meanings.sent4: The roughish painting added character to the room.
meanings.sent5: The roughish sketch captured the essence of the scene.

meanings.definition: Tending to be rough or unruly in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The roughish child kept running around the room.
meanings.sent2: The roughish dog barked loudly at the mailman.
meanings.sent3: His roughish sense of humor often got him into trouble.
meanings.sent4: The roughish students were always causing mischief.
meanings.sent5: The roughish waves crashed against the shore.
